page.title: 01Great Horwood,Bucks.
page.content: Great Horwood is a small village of about 1000 people, which lies about 10 miles north of {Aylesbury}, the county town of Buckinghamshire,and about six miles east of Buckingham. To the north-east of Great Horwood is the new city of{Milton Keynes}and this is having an increasingly important impact on the life of the village. Many villagers work in the new city, and it is an important centre for shopping and for leisure activities. The village has changed in character.Once it was very rural, most of the population was engaged in agriculture either as farmers,farm labourers or an associated trade.Lace making was a common occupation for the women.Today most of the working population commute to nearby towns or as far as London.
